entry.title: Null check the shopping service on the internals page for iOS
entry.content:
It appears to be possible to navigate to the commerce internals page

before the shopping service is available on iOS. This patch adds a

check in the internals constructor to avoid bad access. The page won't

function correctly, but it also won't crash.



Bug: 1511579

entry.title: [ios] Move the logic to select API to SnapshotGenerator
entry.content:
This is a reland of crrev.com/c/5145109. It was reverted because

it was suspicious to cause the issue crbug.com/1514555 but the actual

culprit CL was different.

The code is almost the same as crrev.com/c/5145109 with a little tweak

of comments and the task management (see a comment inline).



This CL moves the logic to select which APIs should be used for

taking snapshot images from

SnapshotTabHelper::UpdateSnapshotWithCallback to SnapshotGenerator.

The callers of SnapshotGenerator don't have to take care of which

APIs are used.



Bug: 1485474

entry.title: Add "feature" keyword to emacs mojom-mode
entry.content:
This CL adds support for the Mojom "feature" keyword:

https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/mojo/public/tools/bindings#features



One edge case I've considered is that this change will cause fields

named "feature" to be highlighted as keywords despite their grammatical

use as a field name. This could be construed as a feature because

punning language keywords as field names should probably be discouraged.

entry.title: iwa: Remove `base::ShadowingAtExitManager` from unit tests
entry.content:
Using `base::ShadowingAtExitManager` seems to be the cause for the

`IsolatedWebAppReaderRegistryFactoryTest` test being flaky on ASAN

builds and causing dangling pointers. The test failures and dangling

pointers all seem to revolve around wrong destruction order of other

`KeyedService`s that are not specifically related to IWAs.



Originally, `IsolatedWebAppReaderRegistryFactory` used

`base::Singleton`, which internally uses `base::AtExitManager`. However,

after the refactoring in crrev.com/c/4573686, the code now uses

`base::NoDestructor`, which does not interact with `base::AtExitManager`

at all. Thus the test also definitely no longer needs to use

`base::ShadowingAtExitManager`. I don't fully remember why I originally

added `base::ShadowingAtExitManager` to the test.



Bug: 925323

Change-Id: I994caf898562a604d37fa3151202667799e6bda1

Fixed: 1515535

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5173247

Auto-Submit: Christian Flach

entry.title: Make cargo vet work with our audits file and gnrt groups for crates
entry.content:
* Fix up the contents of audits.toml to be valid

* Add the imports.lock file which must be present

* Make the config.toml for vet become generated by `gnrt vendor`.

* Forward criteria from the google audit repo into ours so we can

use them.



By generating the config.toml we can specify what policy we want

applied to each crate based on its group and shipped flags in the

gnrt_config.toml.



`cargo vet` does not yet pass, since we are missing audits for almost

all of our 3p crates at their given versions. Since we have reviewed

them, audits should be added next.



Bug: 1314345

entry.title: [OG] Fix country code for PageContentAnnotationsService
entry.content:
Currently, PageContentAnnotationsService queries country code

directly from VariationsService, which will return an empty string

for country code on local builds. This makes functionalities with

country limitation not work on local builds. This CL fixes this

issue by applying a default country code when country code is not

available in VariationsService.



Change-Id: Ib7f1abbdce3c3edd87e737780eba963779d78297

Commit-Queue: Yue Zhang

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1243472}

entry.title: [Passwords] Do not use crowdsourcing when parsing forms on localhost
entry.content:
Crowdsourcing helps to classify forms online, based on signals from

different users about the same form. However on localhost it's likely

that semantically different forms will receive same signatures, so

PasswordManager should not use server predictions and upload votes

for such forms.



The follow-up CL will stop uploading votes.



Bug: 1515560

Change-Id: Ibb2bdf3537e2b54b944c86f099dc90cd370880e1

entry.title: Allow components to be uninstalled w/o registering
entry.content:
Previously attempting to uninstall a component before it was registered

could cause a crash due to a null task runner. The task runner

initialization has been moved to the installer's constructor.



Additionally, Uninstall now operates without relying on registration

info to locate the install directory.



Bug: 1515745

entry.title: [UPMLocalSettings] PasswordSafetyCheckController introduced into password_manager code
entry.content:
This CL introduces the interface PasswordSafetyCheckController that is

supposed to be created as a helper for SafetyCheckMediator to handle

password check state. GmsCorePasswordSafetyCheckController implements

the interface and uses Gms core functionality for the password check.

Method

PasswordsCheckPreferenceProperties.passwordsStateFromPasswordCheckResult

will be used to convert the password check result provided by the

controller into the PasswordsState known to the SafetyCheckMediator.



There will be 2 implementations of the interface:

- One for the password check done on the Gms core side.

- One for the password check in Chrome.



The old Chrome internal implementation will be introduced in the follow

up CLs. The correct version of PasswordSafetyCheckController will be

instantiated and used for the SafetyCheckMediator depending on whether

the Gms core is being used or not.



Bug: b/312930046

entry.title: Dismiss the keyboard when dragging Tab Grid search results
entry.content:
This CL dismisses the keyboard as soon as the scrollview with the search

results is scrolled.



Prior to the new Compositional Layout, this was not an issue, as there

was a bug where the Suggested Actions had a way too large height,

leading to the Suggested Actions not being able to be occluded by the

keyboard. But the Compositional Layout gives it its correct height,

leaving it hidden behind the keyboard.



An alternative fix would be to subscribe to the keyboard notifications,

and adapt the scroll view's additional safe area insets but it's more

cumbersome.

entry.title: Update rounding behavior for battery fill level
entry.content:
There are only 10 dips to play with for battery fill level.



The old behavior always rounds down (floor rounding) so a charge

level of 29% and a charge level of 20% both only have 2 pixels of

fill height.



UX prefers we normally round below 50% battery and floor round

otherwise. This means that a charge level of 25% would have 3 pixels

of fill, so it would look more accurate at lower battery levels.

entry.title: [sharing] Avoid direct exposure of syncer::DeviceInfo in sharing APIs
entry.content:
No behavioral changes, pure refactoring.



Using syncer::DeviceInfo in public sharing APIs such as SharingService

goes against the abstraction layer and leaks the underlying mechanism

to list remote devices via sync. syncer::DeviceInfo also grew over time

and a) contains low-level information that sharing users shouldn't

consume and b) has performance implications when it comes to copying

around device information.



As a first step, this patch introduces SharingTargetDeviceInfo which

is just an alias for syncer::DeviceInfo.

entry.title: Remove UseLegacyBackgroundSizeShorthandBehavior.
entry.content:
This workaround is marked as ‚Äúcan be removed at any time after 2015‚Äù,

and causes NOTREACHED() when background: is set to a custom property.

(This is because we set background to expand to background-size

in the .json5, but the parser does not when this flag is set.)

This fixes one of the top CSS crashes on WebView, since evidently,

some ad out there is doing exactly that.

entry.title: Expand the OperationResult metric to log for all completion callbacks
entry.content:
In addition to logging after the network request completes, the metric

now logs whenever the service's lookup completes, including:

- if it's in backoff mode

- if it fully hits the local cache

- if it fails to fetch a valid OHTTP key



Due to the scope change, the SafeBrowsing.HPRT.OperationResult histogram

is renamed to SafeBrowsing.HPRT.OperationOutcome.

entry.title: display: Resolution inconsistency when native mode is not supported
entry.content:
Currently, when an external display is connected for the first time and

there is no mode selected explicitly by user, calling

`GetActiveModeForDisplayId` will retrieve the native mode. However, this

is incorrect (b/309725817) if native mode is not supported and system

falls back to a lower mode.

currently active mode first.

entry.title: [iOS] change when search engine choice screen appears in tests.
entry.content:
This CL does two related changes in EG-tests.



1: This CL avoid the search-engines choice screen when possible. This

has two benefits:

* tests become faster, as some actions are not needed anymore

* tests that do not consider those screens will not fail.



Those failures seemed to occur only on tests run on developer machine

and not on bots. My assumption is that it is because some developers

are in Europe while the bots are not.



2: The tests that runs with search engine can now be executed on

upstream instead of being only executed in ios_internal.



This CL introduces two new functions, `IsChoiceEnabledInNormalRun` and

`ios::first_run::IsSearchEngineChoiceScreenEnabledFre` that are used

to decide whether the choice view is enabled or not. They behave

similarly:

* if the new forcing flag is enabled, the search engine choice view is

necessarily enabled,

* otherwise, if we are in a build target for tests, the view is

disabled,

* otherwise, if the view is not enabled by the normal feature flag,

then the choice is not enabled

* otherwise we delegate to the choice from the provider.



The last two steps are redundant, as the provider always answer false

when the feature flag is disabled. The goal here is, in a future CL,

to allow to simplify the function in the provider.



This CL is part of the sequence:

+ crrev.com/c/5169127

** crrev.com/i/6838015

** crrev.com/i/6838014

*** crrev.com/c/5168894

**** crrev.com/i/6838016



Low-Coverage-Reason: OTHER Those are tests utils

Bug: 1513366

Change-Id: I87dfbd7ebd6eddcec17b0d5ee18f78e662443d39

entry.title: wayland: dnd: move data fetching out of main thread
entry.content:
So far, in incoming data drag sessions - ie: when drag is originated

in external clients other than the ozone/wayland embedder - the data for

each offered mime type is incrementally fetched in the main/ui thread

using wl_display.sync callbacks. i.e: several wayland roundtrips

potentially required to "announce" the drag enter to the upper layers.

That is sub-optimal and has some side effects related to event

propagation which has been the source of subtle and sometime hard to

diagnose issues.



With this change, the data reading is offloaded to a separate thread and

related tests are updated accordingly. For now, DragEnter keeps coupled

to DataFetchCompleted. That will be addressed in a separate CL.



Design/Explainer: https://github.com/nickdiego/chromium-docs/blob/main/wl-dnd-data-fetch/explainer.md



Bug: 1487784

Test: relevant ozone_unittests updated accordingly.

Change-Id: I6ff692f2d6364091fb45c14034b2e839a3ab8e49

entry.title: Avoid requesting dot prefixed fonts by name during matching
entry.content:
During matching we try to get dot prefixed fonts by their name from the

system using CoreText API. This is invalid API usage, since Apple

restricts access to these fonts.



This CL adds a check for dot prefixed system fonts during matching to

avoid the CoreText calls for these fonts.



Bug: 1131559

entry.title: Refactor paste DLP logic out of ClipboardHostImpl
entry.content:
This CL removes the DataTransferPolicyController logic in

ClipboardHostImpl to put it in chrome/browser/enterprise/data_controls.

This is a necessary refactor for the Data Controls feature as it

requires access to profile-keyed services only available in chrome/.

Since the logic that will be added for Data Controls is very similar

to the existing content analysis code paths, the CL refactors that

path to be reused between existing DLP rules, content analysis, and

upcoming Data Controls logic. This abstracts away details from classes

like ClipboardHostImpl and instead puts those bits in enterprise

directories.



This refactor adds several methods/classes to move the logic through

delegate calls, and also introduces extra information into the

ClipboardEndpoint class to address b/307291932, but otherwise doesn't

change the behavior of existing features.





Bug: b/307291932, b/280449704

Change-Id: I4289cb61c631f6cd7abefabf2fedc177bd1045f5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5054488

entry.title: [iOS] Remove KVO frame observing in fullscreen resizer
entry.content:
KVO is used to track any "frame" value change. This result to call

`updateForCurrentState` at each KVO call. As `updateForCurrentState` is

called after each user scroll, this result to update the frame 2 times

in a row with the exact same values. This CL removes the KVO solution

as the feature works as intended without and it reduce the probability

to have a infinite loop as it will stop listening to its own changes.



Reland of crrev.com/c/5136156

The insta-crash happened when the user had the fullscreen public

version without the improvement. What happened is previously we remmoved

the check of the old value to avoid an infinite loop which is done in

inside `updateForInsets` function for the private and not the public

one. This CL, bring it back so it does not call the function all the

time causing stack overflow => crash.



Pair-Programming: ajuma@



Bug: 1503662

Change-Id: I62d64e456cc83fd3a6ff609ae1770018e35e4e56

entry.title: Do not send cross-frame unsafe fields to the renderer for filling
entry.content:
Previously the fields were cleared and sent to the renderer, which skips

them as part of "not filling empty fields". This has no particular value

and only increases the amount of logic ran by the renderer.



This CL removes the fields in the browser process so that they are not

sent to the renderer for filling. This results in less logic on the

renderer side and smaller mojo messages.

entry.title: Fix CHECK() crash in DawnIOSurfaceRepresentation::BeginAccess()
entry.content:
Some WebGPU cts tests[1] will pass in incompitable view formats with

the format of the IOSurface. In that case,

SharedTextureMemory::BeginAccess() will return false with recent

concurrent SharedTextureMemory change. It causes the CHECK()

crash.



[1] https://gpuweb.github.io/cts/standalone/?q=webgpu:web_platform,canvas,configure:viewFormats:*



Bug: 1493854

entry.title: [WebNN][CrOS]: Support Conv2d and Pool2d operators
entry.content:
Conv2d is a 2-D convolution given the input and filter tensors, and

only nhwc input layout and partial activation are supported at current

stage, serialize a empty buffer with the size of output channel if

there is no bias operand.



Pool2d is an average or max pooling operation across all the elements,

and only nhwc layout is supported.



Bug: 1273291

Change-Id: Ia7e2cf227331eb9a9a2fa9b367d54c7c55ea825c

entry.title: Site settings: Ignore WebUI allowlist provider
entry.content:
CL prevents exceptions from the WebUI allowlist provider from being

displayed to users in settings, as users have no control over those

exceptions.



This replaces the previous logic which looked for WebUI schemes, but

only in the primary pattern, and so missed some exceptions that

should have been hidden.



If another source manages to set an exception with a WebUI scheme,

that will now be not ignored, and will be shown. Other sources are

however user influenceable (e.g. extensions) or should probably

be shown any way (e.g. policy), so this seems like a general improvement.



Bug: 1513663, b/316938069

entry.title: Fix missing/double callback in full card request
entry.content:
Only a single FullCardRequest can be processed at a time. This is

ensured in FullCardRequest::GetFullCard(), by checking whether a

result_delegate_ is already set. Like the code comment explains:

> If the member variable |result_delegate_| is already set, then

> immediately reject the new request through the method parameter



Unfortunately, the new request is not rejected through the method

parameter result_delegate. Instead, result_delegate_, the delegate

corresponding to the currently pending request, is called.



When this happens:

- The result delegate of the new request is never called, neither with

OnFullCardRequestSucceeded() nor with OnFullCardRequestFailed().

- The result delegate of the currently active request is called twice,

once with OnFullCardRequestFailed() and once with the result of the

request.



This bug has been around for several years (introduced by

codereview.chromium.org/2694073002), but hasn't manifested in crashes

until crrev.com/c/5029235 recently landed. Prior to the second CL, the

CCAM stored a pointer to an CCAM::Accessor, which was supposed to be

called only once with the result, but could be called multiple times

without crashing. The CL replaced it with a OnceCallback, which will

crash if called a second time.



Specifically, this caused the linked crash (see bug) in this case:

- A CVC authentication is triggered through CCAM::FetchCreditCard().

This sets the CCAM's on_credit_card_fetched_callback_ OnceCallback.

To perform the authentication, CreditCardCvcAuthenticator::

Authenticate() calls FullCardRequest::GetFullCard() with

CreditCardCvcAuthenticator as its result delegate.

- A FullCardRequest is triggered directly through different means,

like the iOS manual fill feature (whatever that is :)).

As described above, this calls the original request's

OnFullCardRequestFailed(). Since the delegate is the

CreditCardCvcAuthenticator, its OnFullCardRequestFailed() is called,

which loops the result back to the CCAM, invoking the OnceCallback.

- When the request actually finishes, the OnceCallback is invoked a

second time, causing the crash.



Fixed: 1515311

entry.title: Remove PersonalDataManagerObserver::OnInsufficientFormData()
entry.content:
The event is triggered on form submission, if the submitted form doesn't

contain sufficient data for an import. This event only has a single

test-related use, which this CL rewrites. Consequently, the event can be

removed.



In autofill_uitest_util, PdmChangeWaiter supposedly waits for

OnPersonalDataChanged() event. It also treats OnInsufficientFormData()

as an OnPersonalDataChanged() event. This allows writing code like this:

(fill form)

(submit form)

wait using PdmChangeWaiter

By treating OnInsufficientFormData() as OnPersonalDataChanged(), waiting

will stop after either data was successfully imported - or once it was

determined that no import is possible.

By removing OnInsufficientFormData(), all tests that don't import any

data wait forever.



This CL fixes this issue by instead:

- Waiting for submission to complete using TestAutofillManagerWaiter.

- Waiting until all pending DB tasks have completed, by posting a task

to the WebDataService's SequencedTaskRunner. If no import was

triggered, this will be the only task in the queue and it will return

immediately. If an import was triggered, since the form submission

logic has already completed, a pending task for the DB write will

currently be executing. In this case, the new queued task will only

finish after the async import task has finished.



The event is also referenced by some iOS code, which doesn't make use of

it.



Bug: 1007974

Change-Id: Ie68e745ca28bb4d3e8fccd6b0c33b0c05b90cf13

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5158290

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

Reviewed-by: Rohit Rao

Commit-Queue: Florian Leimgruber

Reviewed-by: Christoph Schwering

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1243323}

entry.title: [SharedImage] Make SkiaOutputSurfaceImplOnGPU GLES2 usage read-only
entry.content:
The usage bits here need to capture the variety of clients' eventual

usages, as these SharedImages serve as the destination for clients

making CopyOutputRequests. After discussion, we have concluded that

CopyOutputRequests should be read-only via GLES2 (as they are in

practice now). This CL makes that change.

entry.title: iwa: Fixed SignedWebBundleReader crash
entry.content:
In case when the desired file can't be opened by an instance of

SignedWebBundleReader we see a crash.

To fix it we check if the instance of `connection_` exists.

In addition the `connection_` reset was removed as there is almost no

profit from doing this but it creates a extra complexity. It is

simpler to assume that the `connection_` will be destroyed in the

Reader's destructor (similar to the RAII idiom).



Bug: b/318671239

Test: Added unit test

entry.title: WebNN: Report detailed error messages from mojom::WebNNGraph::Compute
entry.content:
This CL re-defines `mojom::ComputeResult` as the return value of

`mojom::WebNNGraph::Compute()`, let it be `named_outputs` if the

computation was successful and `error` with detailed error messages

that can be exposed to JS for debugging use otherwise.



And this CL also let WebNN service report bad message error and

terminate the renderer if validating the inputs for computation fails.

entry.title: Avoid dangling pointer in BoxLayoutView.
entry.content:
Several views inside NotificationViewBase created BoxLayoutViews,

but then proceeded to treat them as normal Views and reset their

LayoutManagers. Changing that allows to mark the raw pointer to the

LayoutManager in BoxLayoutView as not dangling.



Bug: 1469136
